row.Title: Drawing of GFR dial
row.Description: Intended for use by providers when explaining estimated glomerular filtration rate (eGFR) results, this dial shows how certain eGFR values fall into healthy and unhealthy ranges. A GFR that is = 60 or higher is in the normal range. A GFR below 60 may mean kidney disease. A GFR of 15 or lower may mean kidney failure.
row.Use_noted: Explaining Your Kidney Test Results: A Tear-off Pad for Clinical Use (NKDEP-43)
row.Credit_Line: NIH, National Institute of Diabetes and Digestive and Kidney Diseases
row.Keywords: Kidney Function Tests, Kidney, Kidney Diseases, Glomerular Filtration Rate

row.Title: Photograph of torso with the pancreas and gallbladder
row.Alternate_Text: Photograph of torso with the pancreas and gallbladder. The pancreas is irregular in appearance and extends to the left side of the abdomen. The gallbladder is above the pancreas and is the smaller of the two structures. The bile ducts are the tubes leading to the pancreas.
row.Credit_Line: NIH, National Institute of Diabetes and Digestive and Kidney Diseases
row.Keywords: Bile Duct, Abdomen, Gallbladder, Digestive System, Pancreas
